subject: Re: [junit] Git problems
msgSnippet: ... Kent, Strangely Twitter seems to be unavailable for me at the moment! I m trying the import all of the junit CVS module to a local git repository now. I ll
messageBody:
2009/1/15 Jan Kroeze <thejcwk@...>:
> Have you tried using Tailor ? <http://progetti.arstecnica.it/tailor>
> I've been trying to use it to convert between bzr and svn, but ran into some
> problems. However, it might work for you.
>
> 2009/1/14 kentb <kentb@...>
>
>> All,
>>
>> David and I took y'all's advice and tried importing JUnit into Git. We
>> have
>> a JUnit project on GitHub. The only problem is that when we tried
>> cvsimport,
>> first it didn't exist on my Windows version of Git and then when David ran
>> it it imported everything except HEAD. Frankly, if I had to take my pick I
>> keep HEAD and throw everything else away, but we weren't given that choice
>> :-) Can someone who has been through the CVS->Git process walk us through
>> it? Feel free to contact me privately or on Twitter (@KentBeck).
>>
>> Cheers,
>>
>> Kent Beck
>> Three Rivers Institute

Kent,

Strangely Twitter seems to be unavailable for me at the moment! I'm
trying the import all of the junit CVS module to a local git
repository now. I'll leave it running overnight and let you know how
it went. If it succeeds, I should be able to provide more details or
push it over to github.

Cheers,

James
